title: FS/FT: T206 St. Louisans: Demmitt, O'Hara, Drum, Uzit, etc.
author: Archive

posts.post_title: FS/FT: T206 St. Louisans: Demmitt, O'Hara, Drum, Uzit, etc.
posts.post_content:
Posted By: steve yawitz
I'm in one of my phases of hobby restlessness and feel like shaking things up a bit, so I'm thinking of parting with my T206 St. Louis collection, which includes the two rarities, a handful of rare backs and a couple of high-grade cards. Well, an 80 and 84 - of Hall of Famers, no less - which are nice grades here in Armpit Nation. 

At this point, I'm just looking to trade for other stuff from the pre-WWII era, but if I'm able to work out a deal or two, I'd probably open the floodgates and start pricing the remaining cards. Anyway, if anybody's interested, I have a few T206 St. Louis folders on my site. The first two folders have close-cropped scans while the third one includes full-slab scans of my graded St. Louisans:

Cardinals - [url]http://imageevent.com/yawie99/yawiesbaseballcards/stlouiscardinals[/url]

Browns - [url]http://imageevent.com/yawie99/yawiesbaseballcards/stlouisbrowns[/url]

Graded - [url]http://imageevent.com/yawie99/yawiesbaseballcards/slabbedt206s[/url]

Thanks for looking,
Steve

 

[url]http://imageevent.com/yawie99[/url]

posts.post_title: FS/FT: T206 St. Louisans: Demmitt, O'Hara, Drum, Uzit, etc.
posts.post_content:
Posted By: steve yawitz
I've been expecting you, Perfesser! 



Nah, I'm still here and will always love the Cardinals no matter where I'm at, but I can't stand hobby stagnation. I haven't really picked much up over the last few months and don't foresee that changing unless I'm willing to part with some cards. I'll probably end up keeping a few St. Louisans, but it's time to recycle the cardboard. 

[url]http://imageevent.com/yawie99[/url]

posts.post_title: FS/FT: T206 St. Louisans: Demmitt, O'Hara, Drum, Uzit, etc.
posts.post_content:
Posted By: steve yawitz
I'd first like to apologize for how slow I've been getting back with some of the people who have asked about certain cards - it's just been one of those weeks. I have, though, finally added prices to many of my graded cards. I have not yet added prices to the major rarities since I'm still talking trades with a few people but will hopefully make some decisions on their fate by the end of the weekend.

Thanks again,
Steve

[url]http://imageevent.com/yawie99/yawiesbaseballcards/slabbedt206s[/url]

Edited to add: Noise-bringing offers would be entertained on the unpriced stuff. 

Cash Rules Everything Around Me 
C.R.E.A.M.
Get the money
Dolla dolla bill, y'all
